agenda.description: HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Judiciary & Civil Jurisprudence TIME & DATE: 10:00 AM, Monday, March 18, 2019 PLACE: E2.026 CHAIR: Rep. Jeff Leach HB 1176 Darby Relating to technical defects in instruments affecting real property. HB 598 Price Relating to the use of funds appropriated for the continuing legal education of certain appointed masters, magistrates, referees, and associate judges. HB 1159 Price Relating to the acknowledgment of a written instrument on behalf of a limited liability company. HB 2955 Price Relating to oversight of specialty court programs. HB 1717 White Relating to repealing a provision authorizing a person to hold office as a municipal judge in more than one municipality only if each office is filled by appointment. HJR 72 White Proposing a constitutional amendment permitting a person to hold more than one office as an unpaid municipal judge. HB 770 Davis, Sarah Relating to the establishment of an electronic database for settlement agreements for certain suits involving minors or incapacitated persons; authorizing a fee. HB 790 Davis, Sarah | et al. Relating to recovery of attorney's fees in certain civil cases. HB 2430 Reynolds Relating to requirements in a suit for the removal of human remains from a cemetery. HB 881 Bell, Cecil | et al. Relating to the right of a parent of a deceased person to view the person's body before an autopsy is performed. HB 2737 Wu Relating to judicial guidance related to child protective services cases and juvenile cases. HB 2384 Leach Relating to judicial compensation and the contributions to, benefits from, membership in, and administration of the Judicial Retirement System of Texas Plan One and Plan Two; making conforming changes. HB 2899 Leach Relating to civil liability and responsibility for defects in the plans, specifications, or other documents for the construction or repair of roads, highways, and related improvements. HB 2901 Leach Relating to civil liability and responsibility for the consequences of defects in the plans, specifications, or related documents for the construction or repair of an improvement to real property. HB 2068 Nevárez Relating to exemption from jury service of tribal council members of and legislative employees for certain tribal governments. HB 900 Israel Relating to the act of smoking tobacco in a vehicle with a child present; imposing a civil penalty. HB 439 Shaheen Relating to a limitation on civil suits against persons reporting suspicious activity in good faith. HB 883 Thierry Relating to using the Internet to obtain identifying information about an elderly individual for a fraudulent purpose. HB 1353 Oliverson Relating to liability of health care providers who provide certain assistance in disaster situations. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
